column4: can you ssh into that machine? .. whenever you install nvidia drivers, they change the xorg.conf.. but fortunately, it makes a backup first.. you can try to use the backed up xorg.conf to see if you have any luck
if not even the bios shows.. it's almost definitely hardware
Yeah I figured the video card could be turned off or burnt I wish the first one

on the bright side.. what if it's just your monitor broken? or just a loose connection for opening your lid up too much (laptop right?) .. in that case you should try plugging in svideo or whatever to your TV to see if it works
Also I thought of the auto BIOS reset. If the laptop is left without energy for more than 72 hours it does a reset
I tried connecting it to a external monitor and it doesn't show any images neither the BIOS
it's been around 2 and a half so I am good
then the bios reset is probably your best bet .. xD a little more waiting to go
Yeah I am doing so much stuff on this pc ( studying Computer Engineering Technology ) and I need it badly because I need to read an e-book
that sucks =\ i hope the BIOS reset works.. but you better start saving up some money just in case
I know lolz at least the Hard Drive and Ram is working
Hey which is the package I need to download for adobe flash player
the non-free one i think.. but i usually just download the deb from adobe's website
okay cause my mom gets on my back because she needs freaking Farm Town
